statement.p: This is a circle with radius 6.00 cm inscribed in a square with no side labeled. Round using the rules for measurements.

ol.li: What is the area of the square? \displaystyle\text{cm}^{{2}}
What is the area of the circle? \displaystyle\text{cm}^{{2}}
What is the area of the shaded section? \displaystyle\text{cm}^{{2}}

solution.p: The side length of the square is not given directly. However, because the circle is inscribed, a diameter of the circle is the same length as a side. Thus the square has side length \displaystyle{12.0}\ \text{ cm} and area \displaystyle{12.0}^{{2}}={144}\approx{144}\ \text{ cm}^{{2}}.
The area of the circle is \displaystyle\pi{\left({6.00}^{{2}}\right)}\approx{113.09733552923}\approx{113}\ \text{ cm}^{{2}}.
The area between them (shaded) is \displaystyle{144}-{113.09733552923}={30.902664470767}\approx{30.9}\ \text{ cm}^{{2}}.
